Settings Developers Starter Guide

From Peragro Tempus Wiki

Settings Starters Guide

This starters guide will explain to future "want to be" settings developers how Peragro Tempus settings work, what to do and how to do it.


Introduction and non playable characters

Because the Peragro Tempus team aims for realism and a constantly changing world, the quests, npcs and places need to look alive and unique to the players. It's therefore important for you as future developer to use your fantasy and imagination to the fullest extent. Create strange, unusual, jolly or even cranky npcs that feel alive to the player when he/she interacts with it. Unique dialogs and background creates a feel of interest to the player and they will be wanting to know more about the npc and its history. Always try to keep a sense of realism, Peragro Tempus is unlike other RPGs; a project that tries to loosen up emotions in the player without going too far.

Possible wars and complex politics are daily issues in the world of Phoria, it is up to the player to decide whether to involve him/herself in it or not.

Various Gamesystems

A key element to make an MMORPG a success is to have various gameplay systems. These can vary from riding a mount to playing a game of poker in an inn or sailing your vessel on the ocean. Functionality is the key to a persistent online world. Repeating is boring, diversity rules the world of Peragro.

Quests

Quests are very important in PT, looking for apples is usually a very boring task, not one the player will want to do just to get those 5 pieces of gold. The settings developers try to write up unique quests with the appropriate rewards. A dedicated team of Game masters will perform events to the player as well, these events will be held almost daily and you as future developer will be able to perform and write them yourself.

Rules of writing an npc

When writing an npc make sure you mention their appearance, character, past, and residence. Write a logical description, and don't be afraid to add a little spice to the npcs characteristics.

Books

Some developers are also "burdened" with the task of writing poems, books and scrolls for the player to read. History is very important. Write books of horror, drama, humor or romance and they will be put in the great libraries of each city. Write of wars, cooking or other daily affairs in Phorian society that the players can use to further their character.

Concluding

The developer must be flexible and be able to work under stress. It's vital that Phoria never becomes boring and new quests and dialogs need to be written weekly or even daily when the team desires so.


NPC table: NPC: Character->Physical Features and clothing->Dialog->Placement

Position the npcs in a place that seems logical, put wealthy npcs in wealthy areas and poor npcs in dirty areas.

When work seems too stressful for you be sure to take it easy and ask other settings developers for help. Peragro Tempus is a game worked on by people in their spare time. Only people with a sense of story, imagination and words should apply, knowledge on role-playing is a must.

Read the Peragro wiki more thoroughly to know what the game is all about.
